TextBody:
Hi Andrew,

Our security team reached out to me this week and asked for more details regarding the request, which I provided and I am waiting for their response.
As soon as I have their answer I will let you know.

Thank you,
Eduard Nut
Technical Support Engineer

Hi Eduard,

 

Thank you. Very helpful. Could we coordinate time to review on a working session? We are eastern time zone and could we plan for one of the below:

 

10/3 10:30 AM- 2 PM ET or 3-4 PM

10/4 10:00 AM – 12 PM ET or 1:30-2 PM 

 

Thank you again,

Andrew

 








Andrew P. Singer

Philadelphia, PA 19103-4196

apsinger@duanemorris.com

From: Netwrix Support <techsupport@netwrix.com>
Sent: Tuesday, October 1, 2024 10:55 AM
To: Singer, Andrew P. <APSinger@duanemorris.com>
Subject: Re: Netwrix Support Ticket #421452 - - SMTP issues [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0Fx8KJ:ref ]



 

Hey Andrew,

Port 25 will not be of any use since it is blocked by AWS, which is where we host your appliance.
TLS should work just fine if the configuration is correct.
When setting it up, please use a hostname instead of the IP in the configuration, and if the test email is not sent you can also try using TLS1.3 if the SMTP server is using it.
If you want us to test the configuration in a remote session, please let me know your timezone and availability and I will set it up.

Thank you,
Eduard Nut
Technical Support Engineer

Endpoint Protector now part of Netwrix
DLP | Device Control | Content Aware Protection
eDiscovery | Enforced Encryption
CoSoSys Ltd
www.endpointprotector.com


--------------- Original Message ---------------
From: Singer, Andrew P. [apsinger@duanemorris.com]
Sent: 10/1/2024 2:14 PM
To: techsupport@netwrix.com
Subject: Re: Netwrix Support Ticket #421452 - ref:_00D7091pB._500Q000Fx8KJ:ref - SMTP issues [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0Fx8KJ:ref ]

ref:_00D7091pB._500Q000Fx8KJ:ref

 


Hi Eduard,



 



We are using smtp server on our hosted Proofpoint instance.



 



The server we are planning to use is 67.231.149.12



We would prefer to use TLS but have both 25 and 587 open for testing at this time.



 



It doesn't appear that there is any outbound connectivity from the hosted endpoint protector instance to our SMTP Server.



 



Thank you,



Andrew

TextBody:
Hey Andrew,

The security team has no issue requesting the outbound rule for your SMTP server on port 25.
DevOps will open a request with AWS and let you know once it is done. Since this depends on how fast AWS replies, I cannot provide a time frame for it.

Thank you,
Eduard Nut
Technical Support Engineer
